channel.title: Question of ulmb
channel.description:
I have recently made a web site with ulmb, using a real domain purchased from them also.
I had the forums on it as phpBB3 for awhile til it started getting a SQL error.. We deleted everything and reset the acc, but not the mySQL since it wouldn't let us..
Well now we are trying to install smf, and it won't let us.. it says "I cannot connect to the database because:" and thats all it says when trying to make the new mySQL db for it.. When we type in the information the smf requires it says it cannot connect..
Any ideas?

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:8, topic:312672”]First delete all your databases and users.
The add a db SMF.
Make a user in it with whatever name.
Fill in the right MySQL server, db name, pass, user.
It should work, post any errors here.[/quote]

I fixed it right after I posted, just didn’t bother editing it…

But I figured out what was wrong, and fixed it. thanks all of you.

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

First delete all your databases and users.
The add a db SMF.
Make a user in it with whatever name.
Fill in the right MySQL server, db name, pass, user.
It should work, post any errors here.

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

Already did last night. And the mySQL problem is fixed, there was a problem in all the mySQL databases.

But it still isn’t letting me set up the smf… No idea why…

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @wales_00 wales 00
item.description:
@wales_00 wrote:

Ulmb isn’t the best choice if you want a good web host. Infact purchasing from them wouldn’t give you any benifit.

If you are looking at staying with your current host then use their support forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Why not ask this on their support forum? That’s where you should have gone in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Go to: my mySQL databases and delete all databases
Then make a new one called smf and then on smf just make the sever name “mysql” and database 1111_smf (The 1111 will be displayed on mySQL databases)
Should work.

Why cant you delete the database?

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:2, topic:312672”]make sure the mySQL db name and the name u input in SMF’s install is the same.
some hosts add the user name in front of the db too. like smf_something[/quote]
It is… But i went on the ulmb forums, and more ppl are getting this… So I think its the hosts fault.

Read full topic

item.title: Question of ulmb
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

make sure the mySQL db name and the name u input in SMF’s install is the same.
some hosts add the user name in front of the db too. like smf_something

Read full topic
